main.name: Trevor Seet
main.description: Currently looking for opportunities to start my journey with a company centered around passion and teamwork
main.bio: I love watching travel or food related videos on youtube, eating at new restaurants, and hiking upstate. Fun fact: I took interest in badminton and bowling in high school. Before making my transition into tech, I was an assistant General Manager at Chipotle. I was able to see the progression of their app from their launch day. I observed all the flaws of the app from both the customers and workers view. It bothered me that if people wanted a quesadilla, they didn't have a button for it, which caused a huge inconvenience for everyone (still to this day, try it). That triggered my interest in app development.
main.contactmessage: Get in touch with me to receive further details, get coached or anything else.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Completed 99 credits towards a bachelors degree

work.title: Assistant General Manager
work.description: Conducted interviews and trained 20-25 new hires. Developed daily goals to improve P&L by $100+ on most days. Acted as a food safety leader to 10-13 crew members throughout shifts.

skills.name: Node, Javascript, React, Redux, Postgres, Sequelize, Express
CSS, HTML, Git, Sequelize, Express, Firebase

projects.title: Calamity Monitor
projects.category: A PWA displaying the most up to date Covid-19 data and news. Built with React, ArchGIS, News API, D3, & MUI.

projects.title: Tech Tracker
projects.category: A 4 person ecommerce project for Fullstack Academy. Incorporated sessions, admin functionality & more.

projects.title: Won Tu Fiddy
projects.category: Solo project inspired by a game on the app store. Goal is to click tiles 1 to 50 consecutively. Built with ReactJS & Redux.

projects.title: 99cent
projects.category: Amazon clone built alongside Youtuber Clever Programmer. Built with Stripe, Firebase backend, & React Hooks.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Sonny Sangha must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
